docs.snippet: Tesla’s inability to meet production goals and the E.P.A.’s easing of mileage rules may delay electrification of vehicles, but it still will happen.

headline.print_headline: Tesla’s Problems Won’t Stop Electric Cars
headline.main: Tesla’s Manufacturing ‘Hell’ Won’t Slow Down Electric Cars

docs.snippet: The author of a provocative Facebook memo declaring that growth is justified even if it costs lives says he doesn't actually agree with the memo and wrote it to provoke debate.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Exec Disavows His Own Provocative Memo
headline.main: Facebook Exec Disavows His Own Provocative Memo

docs.snippet: Readers discuss how Cambridge Analytica provided information to the Trump campaign.
A state proposal to limit the number of drugs covered by Medicaid, fiercely opposed by patients and drug companies, has drawn national attention as states struggle to pay for costly new medicines.

headline.print_headline: Massachusetts Is Tackling Drug Cost. It’ll Be a Fight.
headline.main: Massachusetts, a Health Pioneer, Turns Its Focus to Drug Prices. It’s in for a Fight.

docs.snippet: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday ordered the withdrawal of rules punishing journalists held responsible for distributing "fake news", giving no reason for the change, less than 24 hours after the original announcement.

headline.print_headline: India Drops Plan to Punish Journalists for 'Fake News' Following Outcry
headline.main: India Drops Plan to Punish Journalists for 'Fake News' Following Outcry

docs.snippet: Your daily look at late-breaking news, upcoming events and the stories that will be talked about Friday:
China's Commerce Ministry urged Washington on Thursday to discard planned tariffs it warned might set off a chain reaction that could disrupt global trade and said Beijing will "fight to the end."

headline.print_headline: China Appeals to Washington to Give Up Tariff Plan
headline.main: China Appeals to Washington to Give Up Tariff Plan

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration said on Thursday it would no longer presume that many pregnant women detained by immigration authorities should be released from custody, reversing an Obama-era directive.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Ends Presumed Freedom for Pregnant Immigrants
headline.main: U.S. Ends Presumed Freedom for Pregnant Immigrants

docs.snippet: The State Department wants to require all U.S. visa applicants to submit their social media usernames, previous email addresses and phone numbers, vastly expanding the Trump administration's enhanced vetting of potential immigrants and visitors.

headline.print_headline: US to Seek Social Media Details From All Visa Applicants
headline.main: US to Seek Social Media Details From All Visa Applicants

docs.snippet: Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events and the media actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

headline.print_headline: Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don’t Keep Up With the News?
headline.main: Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don’t Keep Up With the News?
